thread.title: Jon Rahm wears Pat Tillman jersey at WM Phoenix Open
thread.title_full: Jon Rahm wears Pat Tillman jersey at WM Phoenix Open

author: azcentral sports
title: Jon Rahm wears Pat Tillman jersey at WM Phoenix Open
text:
Jon Rahm wears Pat Tillman jersey at WM Phoenix Open Scott Bordow , azcentral sports Published 1:01 p.m. MT Feb. 2, 2017 | Updated 60 minutes ago CLOSE x Share Former Sun Devil Jon Rahm talks about wearing a No. 42 Pat Tillman jersey with the name 'Rahmbo' on the back. Video: azcentral sports Jon Rahm wears a Pat Tillman No. 42 Arizona State football jersey with the name 'Rahmbo' on the 16th hole during the first round of the Waste Management Phoenix Open in Scottsdale, Ariz., at TPC Scottsdale on Feb. 2, 2017. (Photo: Rob Schumacher/azcentral sports) 
Phil Mickelson always will be the fan favorite at the Waste Management Phoenix Open but fellow Arizona State Sun Devil Jon Rahm is giving him a run for the crowd’s affection. 
On the par-3 16th hole Rahm threw on an Arizona State No. 42 Pat Tillman jersey with “Rahmbo” stitched on the back. He drew a roar, although it was a bit more subdued than usual because his featured threesome that included Jordan Spieth and Ricky Fowler teed off at 7:57 a.m. on the back nine. 
MORE: Phoenix Open section | Leaderboard 
“That’s one of my nicknames. It’s the first one that comes up for sure,” Rahm said after shooting a “pretty solid” 1-under 70. “I did it two years ago and enjoyed it. Today was a little early for anybody to be there but I’m pretty sure (Friday) will be a little louder.” Wearing a jersey. — PGA TOUR (@PGATOUR) February 2, 2017 
Rahm’s round included an all-world par on the 470-yard par-4 fifth hole. His drive stayed left and hit a water bottle that a fan had in his pocket. From the rough, Rahm’s second shot plugged into the bunker short of the green. 
• Phoenix Open fan guide | Bird's Nest concert guide | Transportation tips 
No problem. He barely cleared the lip with his bunker shot and the ball rolled into tap-in range for the par. 
“I didn’t know I hit a fan,” Rahm said. “Nobody told me. That bunker shot wasn’t easy but all I needed to do was get it up on the front of the green. If I could fly it there I knew the ball would release.” 
It’s the sort of par Mickelson has made throughout his career. Must be something about maroon and gold. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. David Wallace/azcentral sports Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay 
Location : TPC Scottsdale, Stadium Course. 
Address : 17020 N. Hayden Road, Scottsdale. 
Information : 480-585-4334. Thursday's notables 
Shot of the day 
Brendan Steele posted an eagle on the 14th, the second most difficult hole Thursday and most difficult last year, after he holed out from 194 yards with his second shot on the par 4. 
Round of the day 
Matt Kuchar shot a 7-under 64. After two birdies on the front nine, he posted a 31 on the back nine with three birdies and an eagle. 
Quote of the day 
"Now I have a wife, two dogs, a mortgage. I'm starting to treat it more like a job, and I'm really just getting sick of underachieving." - John Peterson, who shot a 66 in the first round. 
Attendance 
104,320 (101,021 in 2016; record is 118,461 in 2015). 
Friday's weather forecast 
Partly cloudy but sunny, high of 74. 
Friday's featured group 
7:57 a.m., 10th tee: Justin Thomas, Phil Mickelson, Adam Hadwin; 12:07 p.m., 1st tee: Jon Rahm, Jordan Spieth, Rickie Fowler. 
Easiest hole 
The par-5 13th hole. The field averaged 4.534 strokes on the hole on Thursday. 
Toughest hole 
The par-4 14th. The field averaged 4.244 strokes on the hole on Thursday. 
What happened to... 
Pat Perez. The former Sun Devil, who won in November in Mexico for his second career PGA Tour victory, withdrew after the sixth hole on Thursday. He later tweeted: "Sorry folks. Shoulder has flared up again. Have to try and protect if for the rest of the year. Until next week." Tickets 
General admission tickets are $40. Children ages 17 & under are free when accompanied by an adult. Tickets: 800-745-3000 or go to wmphoenixopen.com or ticketmaster.com . First responders as well as all active, reserve and retired military personnel and one accompanying individual are free all week. 
Friday's schedule 
7:30 a.m. — Waste Management Phoenix Open, second round 
3:30 p.m. — Coors Light Birds Nest entertainment tent opens 
Saturday's schedule 
All day - The annual 'Green Out' event, in which everyone is encouraged to wear green as Waste Management works to promote eco-sensitive efforts. 
9 a.m. — Waste Management Phoenix Open, third round 
3:30 p.m. — Coors Light Birds Nest entertainment tent opens 
RELATED: List of tournament winners 
Sunday's schedule 
9 a.m. — Waste Management Phoenix Open, final round (if there is a tie at the end of 72-holes, the tournament will go to a sudden death playoff) 
Monday's schedule 
9 a.m. — Post Open Pro-Am at the TPC Stadium Course Parking 
Public parking is free. There is also a with shuttle providing access to the tournament gates. Lot H is a public parking lot at Loop 101 and Hayden Road. It is recommended that eastbound Loop 101 drivers exit at Hayden and drive south into the parking lot. Lot W is at WestWorld. It is recommended that drivers exit Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd., then drive north to Bell Road on 94th street and then into the parking lot. The free shuttles from Lot H will operate Friday and Saturday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. and Sunday from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. The free shuttles from Lot W will operate Friday and Saturday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. and Sunday from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. TV schedule 
Friday, 1 – 5 p.m., Golf Channel. 
Saturday, 11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m., Golf Channel; 1 – 4 p.m., Channel 5. 
Sunday, 11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m., Golf Channel; 1 – 4 p.m., Channel 5. 474 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE
